poem:
Title: "Harris, the Hurried Herald"

Upon emerald isles, a new voice sings,
Loud as raucous bells, clear as pealing springs.
Hush the hubbub, Harris cries,
"Chillax" echoes 'mongst the druids' sighs.
Latin? Nay, a new age lexicon.
The tides of change roll on and on. 
In the rush, some wisdom lost,
Yet youth commands, despite the cost.
